intro: Oxydectes indivisa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads. It is typically found in grassy areas and is adapted to arid conditions. Oxydectes indivisa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
